section: i-on will maintain the operation of the Hosted Site continuously, twenty-four (24) hours per day, seven (7) days per week, including holidays, with the exception of necessary hardware and software maintenance that must be performed on the Hosting Computer and/or the Hosted Site. i-on will schedule and perform such maintenance at its convenience, without prior notice.
explanation: The contract states that i-on will maintain the site continuously, but then contradicts itself by stating that maintenance will be performed at i-on's convenience without prior notice. This creates ambiguity because the customer is not aware of when the website will be down for maintenance and how long it will be down for. There is no indication that the customer will receive notice for the maintenance, nor is there a maintenance schedule.

section: Under this Agreement, i-on will provide the following limited services for the Hosted Site: 1. connectivity to the Internet via a T1 (that may be shared by other Web sites) to a leading Internet backbone access provider such as UUNET, and will not be responsible for maintaining such connectivity with the phone company and the Internet backbone access provider;
explanation: This is a contradiction because it says they will provide connectivity to the internet, but then says they will not be responsible for maintaining such connectivity with the phone company and the Internet backbone access provider. If they are not responsible for maintaining connectivity, then they are not responsible for providing connectivity. This means that they are not providing any services.

section: The Customer is responsible for paying i-on the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees within 30 days of receiving the invoice. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner may result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
explanation: While stating the customer is responsible for paying within 30 days, it does not specify when the invoice will be received by the customer. If the customer receives the invoice at the end of the month, it would be an extremely short period of time. If the invoice is sent at the end of the following month, it would be a long period of time. This is considered ambiguous because it does not give a clear indication of when the invoice will be sent to the customer.
